>install M6 (over my current M5)

This has never been supported. You must install eclipse in a new folder.

Well, in former version (pre 3.1) it worked well. If I always have to install 
such an update in a new directory, I also have to install all the plugins again 
and again ... :-(  There should be an update option.

M5 and M6 are fundamentally different since we are now shipping with jars which
no longer older version of the plugins.
If you want to avoid to have to reinstall other plugins everytime, you should
put them in another folder and link to it. Therefore when you change eclipse
base, you just have to recreate the link.
See Help > Software update > Manage config. Then right clik, extension location.

I read in the Eclipse help about extensions and it says that it needs xml 
schema with grammar ... and you need to fill out some forms. But the plugin 
just is a (pre-M6) plugin directory that I copied in the eclipse/plugins/ 
directory. So, how can I use this as a plugin extension?

It seems , these "extensions" are just for plugin developers, but i just use 
plugins. when i click "Add an Extension Location" in the Product Configuration 
window, I need to select a directory and I get this message:

"Selected location does not contain a product extension. An extension should 
consist of a directory named eclipse, which contains a marker file 
called .eclipseextension and the features and plugins folders. Please select 
another location."

As I need to create such a directory, I naturally don't have such 
a ".eclipseextension" file...

It is not restricted to developers.
This is the way large product ship eclipse based app.

you are confusing plugin extensions with product extensions.  Bad naming 
perhaps but it evolved that way.  

Anyway, did you try what Pascal suggested?  It just works.  I don't think you 
need an .exclipseextensions file.  either that or it gets written for you.

As for the original problem, unziping over a previous install has never been 
supported.  If it worked, you were lucky

linking a folder under windows isn't an easy solution to anything

If this method is not supported (though I could SWEAR this was what I've been
told to do since 2.0), what IS the supported method for upgrading all settings
with a new install?

I really think that if this upgrade method isn't supported then a real windows
installer (rather than just a zip file) is an absolute must. While the original
problem may not be a bug because you don't support this method, I think this is
a HUGE issue for windows users and should be reopened as a major,
gotta-have-it-for-the-next-release-no-matter-what feature request.

I sense confusion here.  "linking" is nothing special.  It basically amounts to 
dropping a file in a "link" directory in the root of some Eclipse install.  
This is not an OS thing and will work on any setup.  It is not deprecated or 
discouraged.  It is fully supported.

What is not supported is unziping new builds over old.  And certainly not non 
release builds.  In the development cycle we do all manner of incompatible 
things from build to build.  We need that freedom to make progress.

I don't quite follwo what you mean by "method of upgrading all settings with a 
new install".  What settings?
*** Bug 90722 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
